Message.Title: Today's Jobs Report
Message.Msg: An aberration. A none-event. Don't get fooled.

Gaining momentum... Growth Markets Embracing IBM PureSystems to Help Ease IT Complexity and Skills Shortage -- 700+ Business Partners adopt IBM PureSystems, 1,300 Complete IBM Training -- 160+ Solutions and Patterns of Expertise from IBM and Business Partners across 20 industries -- New financing options for IBM PureSystems allow organizations to defer first payment for 90 days
As I posted before the opening, today's jobs report will prove an aberration. With the Dow up 200, time to get out.

Pure Systems looks great - thanks for the link. Since Yahoo seems to be more liberal, here's the link to the Presentation from IBM Fellow Geranno Cuomo that you find if you hit the link on his name on the page you provided. Topic.Title: IBM must acquire both AKAM & RIMM, big blue will fly

Message.Msg: They key word in your reply is "expertise." As for your ending comment GO BIG BLUE you must be related to the poster on the Xerox board GO BIG X!!!!!!!!!!! IBM has no expertise in small hand-held devices. Very little if I may correct the word NO. They gave up laptops and computers in general. Everybody touts WATSON on this board as an example of a success story. OK, that is big IRON, monsterous mainframe territory, BIG DATA, super fast processors. Not hand-helds. So the supposed "expertise" is zero, unless you can squeeze Watson into a hand-held.

Topic.Title: IBM must acquire both AKAM & RIMM, big blue will fly

Message.Msg: " Rejected-a-rowe babbles: " IBM has no expertise in small hand-held devices. Very little if I may correct the word NO. They gave up laptops and computers in general." IBM got out of manufacturing small devices in mass but IBM has a lot of small device patents including wearable computer patents from the '90's thru 2005. Richard Sapper was doing design work for IBM to give the technology functional form. IBM has numerous custom designs for hand held devices like those used by the ITF. At Wimbledon big Tennis events have mobile security thru IBM designed PDA's. IBM developed "Point Tracker" And of course cyclops makes the calls. All of the real time statistics for Wimbledon events are from IBM analytics -- they advertise this quite a bit rejected, so give a care and drop the careless generalities -- you're in the Biggs when you talk IBM. But maybe Big Blue has already sold some patents to Google. Geez rejected, your fetish is showing again. http://vimeo.com/20398025
Well feed the bear if you must.
Agreed. IBM is my core holding, and I have been adding position in the past several weeks.
